summary: Email correspondence between legal and law enforcement personnel regarding arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell to review discovery materials (photos on a secure laptop) at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The email discusses Maxwell's attorneys' request for her to review the laptop alone and seeks the FBI's position on the matter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; her attorneys are arranging for her to review discovery photos on a secure laptop at the MDC.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Referenced as the judge to whom an explanation may need to be provided if the FBI does not permit Maxwell to review the laptop alone.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in Maxwell's case, as referenced in the email discussing potential explanations to the court.

events.title: Scheduled Discovery Review
events.description: Maxwell's attorneys arranged for her to review discovery photos on a secure laptop at the MDC from 8am to 3pm.

keyFacts: Maxwell's attorneys requested she be allowed to review discovery photos on a secure laptop alone in a visitor room at the MDC, citing the jail setting as preventing copying.
The FBI was asked to decide whether to permit Maxwell to review the laptop alone, with the implication that their position would need to be explained to Judge Nathan if they refused.
The email exchange occurred in October 2020, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's case, highlighting logistical and security considerations for discovery review.
